text: The Oracle of Agur
The words of Agur, son of Yakeh, the oracle.
Thus says the man to Ithiel, to Ithiel, and Ucal:\f + \fr 30:1 \ft Or “I am weary, O God; I am weary, O God, and worn out” \f*
Certainly I \add am more\add* stupid than a man,
and the understanding of humankind \add is\add* not for me.
And I have not learned wisdom,
nor will I know knowledge of the Holy One.\f + \fr 30:3 \ft Or “holy ones” \f*
Who has ascended \add to\add* heaven and come down?
Who has gathered \add the\add* wind in the hollow of his hand?
Who has wrapped water in a\f + \fr 30:4 \ft Hebrew “the” \f* garment?
Who has established all the ends of the earth?
What \add is\add* his name and what is the name of his child?
For \add surely\add* you know.
Every word of God \add is\add* flawless;
he \add is\add* a shield for him who takes refuge in him.
Do not add to his words
lest he rebuke you and you be found a liar.
Two things I ask from you;
do not deny me before I die:
Keep falsehood and a ⸤lying word⸥\f + \fr 30:8 \ft Literally “word of a lie” \f* far from me;
do not give me poverty or wealth;
provide me \add with\add* food \add only for\add* my need.
Or else I will be satisfied and will deny \add him\add*
and say “Who \add is\add* Yahweh?”
Or\f + \fr 30:9 \ft Or “Lest” \f* I will be poor and will steal
and profane the name of my God.
Do not slander a servant to his master,
or else he will curse you and you will be guilty.
\add There is\add* a generation \add that\add* will curse its father,
and its mother it will not bless.
\add There is\add* a generation \add that is\add* pure in its own eyes,
but from its filthiness it will not be cleansed.
\add There is\add* a generation—how lofty \add are\add* their eyes!
And their eyelids they will lift.
\add There is\add* a generation whose teeth \add are\add* swords,
and its jawbones, knives,
\add in order\add* to devour the poor from the earth\f + \fr 30:14 \ft Or “land” \f*
and the needy from humankind.
For the leech, \add there are\add* two daughters;
“Give, give!” \add they cry\add*.
As for three of these, they are not satisfied;
as for four, they do not say enough.
Sheol\f + \fr 30:16 \ft A term for the place where the dead reside, i.e., the Underworld \f* and barrenness of womb,
the land is not satisfied \add with\add* water,
and fire does not say “enough!”
The eye \add that\add* mocks a father
and scorns the obedience of a mother—
the ravens of the valley will peck it out,
and the offspring of vultures will eat it.
Three of these are \add too\add* wonderful for me,
and four, I do not understand them:
the way of the eagle in the sky,
the way of a snake on a rock,
the way of a ship in the heart of the sea,
and the way of a man with a young woman.
This is the way of a woman committing adultery:
she eats and wipes her mouth,
and says “I have not done wrong.”
Under three \add things\add* the earth\f + \fr 30:21 \ft Or “land” \f* trembles,
and under four, it is not able to bear up:
under a slave when he becomes king,
and a fool when he is satisfied \add with\add* food;
under an unloved woman when she gets married,
and a maid when she succeeds her mistress.
There \add are\add* four small things on the earth,
and they \add are\add* ⸤exceedingly wise⸥:\f + \fr 30:24 \ft Literally “wise \fq ones \ft from wise \fq ones \ft ” \f*
The ants \add are\add* a people \add who are\add* not strong,
yet they prepare their food in the summer;
the badgers \add are\add* a people \add who are\add* not mighty,
yet they set their house on the rock;
there is no king for the locust,
yet it marches in rank;
a lizard you \add can\add* seize with hands,
yet it is in palaces of kings.
There \add are\add* three \add things\add* that are magnificent of stride,
and four that are magnificent \add when\add* moving:
a mighty lion among the beasts,\f + \fr 30:30 \ft Hebrew “beasts” \f*
but he will not turn back from ⸤any face⸥;\f + \fr 30:30 \ft Literally “faces of all” \f*
a strutting rooster or he-goat,
and a king \add whose\add* army \add is\add* with him.
If you have been foolish by exalting yourself,
and if you have devised evil, \add put your\add* hand to \add your\add* mouth.
For pressing milk produces curd,
and pressing the nose produces blood,
so pressing ⸤anger⸥\f + \fr 30:33 \ft Literally “nostrils” \f* produces strife.
